info.name: BBData Output API
info.description:
![bbdata](http://daplab.ch/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/bbdata-logo.png)

This document describes the different endpoints available through the bbdata output api endpoint, a json REST api to let you manage, view, and consult objects and values.
* [bbdata admin interface](https://bbdata-admin.daplab.ch): a web interface to manage objects, objectgroups, users and permissions;
* [input api](https://bbdata.daplab.ch/input): api used to submit new values;
* [source code](https://gitlab.forge.hefr.ch/bbdata): bbdata organisation on gitlab.forge (protected)
__v0.4__:

* add endpoints `/values/quarters` and `/values/hours` to query aggregations
* support CSV media-type for all endpoints under `/values`. Now, you can also get values in a CSV format by specifying `Content-Type: text/plain` in the header !
* support for optional header and prettyprint: for all endpoints under `/values`, use the query param `headers=true` to get headers (CSV) and `prettyprint=true` to have your json response in a readable and formatted way (more overhead, though).

* __WARNING__: values (endpoint `/values`) are not automatically cast to int or float anymore, but __always returned as strings__

__v0.3.2__: 

* move `/objects/{id}/values` endpoints to `/objects/values`
* create a `/values` subresource and add a `/values/latest` endpoint 
* add more query parameters to `/objects` endpoint: search, pagination

__v0.3__: 

* add `/objects/{id}/enabled` and `/objects/{id}/disabled` endpoints 
* add `/comments` subresource
* more coherent status codes

__v0.2__: 

* add `/userGroups/{id}/users/new` endpoint to allow user creation
* add POST `/units` to allow units creation

request.description: Get all comments from objects you have read access to.

response.name: response
response.status: The resource was not found or you don't have access to it.

request.description: Get all comments for some objects, for example objects 1 and 4889. Don't forget to list ids of objects you have access to (see `/object` for a complete list).

response.name: response
response.status: The resource was not found or you don't have access to it.

request.description: create a new comment. The id of the comment will be stored in the `new_comment_id` global variable, which will be used in other requests.

response.name: response
response.status: The resource was not found or you don't have access to it.

request.description: Get details about a comment. By default, it uses the `new_comment_id` global variable which is set by the _comment: add new_ request.

response.name: response
response.status: The resource was not found or you don't have access to it.

request.description: Edit a comment. By default, it uses the `new_comment_id` global variable which is set by the _comment: add new_ request.

response.name: response
response.status: The resource was not found or you don't have access to it.

request.description: Delete a comment. By default, it uses the `new_comment_id` global variable which is set by the _comment: add new_ request and then unset the variable upon success.

response.name: response
response.status: The resource was not found or you don't have access to it.

request.description: Get server information, such as the current time and the version/built date of the API.

item.name: login
item.description: Login to the API. This will create a new temporary apikey valid for two hours and store its id in the global variable `bbtoken-1`.

request.description: Use your username and password to create a read/write apikey valid for 2 hours.

response.name: response
response.status: The request has invalid or missing parameter(s).

request.description: Logout will delete the token used for authentication (i.e. the bbtoken header field).
get information about your profile.
return all usergroups you belong to.
return all usergroups in which you have admin rights.
List all your apikeys.
create a new apikey with write access valid 1 hour. The id will be stored into the `new_apikey_id` global variable.

response.name: response
response.status: The request has invalid or missing parameter(s).

request.description: create a new apikey read-only and with no expiration date.

response.name: response
response.status: The request has invalid or missing parameter(s).

request.description: get all objectGroups, without their objects.
get all objectGroups where you have administration rights, listing their objects as well.

request.description: Add an object to the object group defined by the `new_ogroup_id` global variable. Don't forget to change the id to an object you have admin rights to.

response.status: The resource was not found or you don't have access to it.

response.name: response

request.description: Remove the object group whose id is stored in the `new_ogroup_id` global variable, unsetting the variable if it succeeds.

request.description: Create a new user and add it to the group denoted by `new_ugroup_id`. Please, since users cannot be deleted, use it with parcimony and prefix dummy users with `test-`... The new user id will be stored into the `new_user_id` global variable.
